author: David Maddock
title: Liverpool bounced back to form against Tottenham after inspirational players-only meeting called by skipper Jordan Henderson
text:
ANDY DUNN: Irresistible Liverpool make it one down, 13 to go for Klopp's dream run-in 
The response was more than Liverpool could have hoped for, and one which all but destroyed Spurs’ title hopes. 
The Londoners were blown away by a whirlwind of a first-half performance from the Mersey men at Anfield. 
Two goals from Sadio Mane in as many early first-half minutes (he could have had a hat-trick in six minutes, but for an incredible save from Hugo Lloris) exposed Spurs’ Premier League pretensions. Thr win also reasserted lost Anfield identity. 
“Every now and again, it doesn’t hurt to utter some home truths as long as it is not personal, just purely professional,” Lallana explained. Sadio Mane gave Liverpool a 16th minute lead... (Photo: Liverpool FC via Getty) ..then doubled their advantage just two minutes later (Photo: Getty for Tottenham Hotspur) Read More Boss Jurgen Klopp hails 'perfect' Liverpool after comfortable win over Spurs 
“There is no harm in reminding each other of what we need to do and what we want from each other. It doesn’t hurt to hear a few home truths. 
"Yes, we are in a difficult place and at times it feels like it is us against the world when things aren’t going well. That showed today. Credit to Jordan for calling the meeting, credit to everyone for participating, and credit to everyone for performing like they did today.” 
Liverpool looked rudderless during a miserable January, but Saturday's display was full of purpose. 
Boss Klopp’s stated pre-match dream of winning every remaining Premier League game does not seem so absurd on the evidence. Beaming boss Jurgen Klopp thanks skipper Henderson after the final whistle (Photo: Liverpool FC via Getty) Read More Revealed! Klopp's plans for Liverpool now there is no game for two weeks 
They’d have a better chance if between now and May they met only top-four chase rivals - the Reds are unbeaten this season in such contests. 
Mane's return from Africa Cup Of Nations duty has come just in time for Liverpool, who named a front four - the Senegalese plus Philippe Coutinho, Roberto Firmino, and Lallana - bursting with intent. 
There were leaders all over the pitch. And in producing such a performance – they could have been five up at half-time – they questioned whether Spurs have any at all. 
For defender Eric Dier, there was an unspoken admission his side still have some way to go before they can seriously challenge the ruthless professionalism of Chelsea at the top of the table. A scream of frustration from Dele Alli as Spurs' title hopes take a big hit (Photo: Reuters) Read More Coutinho's role in the Liverpool wall against Spurs was either brilliant or crazy 
He was one of several Spurs stars who didn’t meet their usual standards, with the second-placed team managing just one real chance. 
And when asked if Spurs are mentally strong enough to compete for the title, Dier said with a shrug: “I think we still need to improve in all areas. 
"We still have a long way to go and we need to keep improving and working hard. We weren’t good enough in the first half.” poll loading Who'll be higher in this season's final table? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
